page.title: 01BERRYNARBOR AREA GENERAL
page.content: The 4km x 3km section grid ref 02520144 slopes north towards the Bristol Channel and on a clear day Wales can be seen.Many of the valleys have steep wooded slopes. Apart from the sections covering Ilfracombe and part of Berrynarbor village there are only isolated farms some of which have existed since the 1066 Domesday book. Most of the roads are narrow winding country lanes, mainly being slightly more than the width of one car, with passing bays for cars to pass when they meet. The lanes and fields have high hedges built from stone and earth with trees and bushes growing from them and covered with many plants.Travellers along these country roads will oftenmeet tractors or at milking time herds of cows going from field to farm
